title: Biden questions 'who the hell needs' high capacity assault weapons in wake of Maine shootings
description: Biden harshly criticized the use of high capacity assault weapons in his first public remarks on gun violence following this week's shooting in Lewiston, Maine.

title: A killer known for his 'zombie hunter' costume is on death row, but some suspect he has another victim
description: "Zombie hunter" Bryan Patrick Miller was sentenced to death for a pair of horrific Phoenix murders in the early 1990s, but did he confess to a third murder?

title: California man who drove through 2021 'Stop Asian Hate' rally pleads guilty
description: A Southern California man accused of driving through a crowd of “Stop Asian Hate” protesters in 2021 pleaded guilty on Thursday to a federal civil rights charge.

title: Hollywood strike negotiators under mounting pressure to make a deal
description: The months-long actor's strike has wreaked havoc on Hollywood.

title: Manhunt for Lewiston shooting suspect enters third day as authorities scour Maine
description: Authorities are searching for the suspect who is accused of killing 18 people on Wednesday evening in a mass shooting in Lewiston, Maine

title: How to maintain a healthy scalp
description: A healthy scalp is vital for healthy hair. Shop products from Virtue, Dr. Barbara Sturm, Ouai, Christophe Robin and more to add to your hair care routine.

title: Maine's 'yellow flag' law scrutinized as 'woefully weak' after mass shooting
description: Gun safety advocates ripped Maine’s firearm laws as ineffective Friday after a suspected gunman, whose family said he was experiencing an “acute” mental health episode, allegedly shot dead more than a dozen people, triggering an ongoing manhunt.

title: With no fanfare or acknowledgment, Biden hosts White House meeting with Muslim leaders
description: President Joe Biden quietly hosted a meeting Thursday for a handful of Muslim leaders, according to four sources familiar with the White House gathering.

title: The 9 best sales to shop right now
description: Holiday shopping doesn’t have to wait. Get a headstart with deals from Paula’s Choice, Walmart and more

title: An influencer took down ‘dupe’ videos of her designs. People were divided on the move.
description: An influencer set off a debate on the ethics of promoting replicas on TikTok after her team took down videos featuring dupes — duplicates of brand-name products — of her brand’s fruit print pajamas.

title: Longest-serving Black congressional staffer, Bertie Bowman, dies at 92
description: Congress’ longest-serving Black staffer, Herbert “Bertie” Bowman, who worked his way up from sweeping the steps of the Capitol as a teenager to coordinating one of the Senate’s most important committees, died this week.

title: Dean Phillips says Biden should 'hand the torch' in new ad
description: Rep. Dean Phillips is launching a new ad for his presidential campaign by saying it's time for President Joe Biden to "hand the torch" to the next generation.

title: A new Covid variant has become dominant amid slow uptake of the updated shots
description: A new Covid variant, HV.1, has become dominant, but relatively few people have gotten the new vaccines that could offer protection.

title: Democratic Rep. Dean Phillips says he’s running for president because he thinks Biden might lose to Trump
description: Rep. Dean Phillips, D-Minn., said on Friday that he’s challenging President Joe Biden for the Democratic nomination for president because he doesn’t think Biden can win next year’s general election.

title: Hurricane Otis survivors in Acapulco are still looking for relatives in the devastating aftermath
description: From unburying their homes to looking for food and supplies, Acapulco, Mexico, residents grapple with the devastating aftermath of Hurricane Otis, the strongest in decades.

title: Fisherman rescued after 13 days adrift at sea
description: A fisherman who spent nearly two weeks adrift in a life raft off the coast of Washington state is back on dry land after being spotted by a passing boat. KING's Madison Wade reports.

title: FBI was once asked to hunt down soccer legend Diego Maradona’s urine sample, records show
description: Newly released records show that, in 1996, investigators in South America asked the FBI to track down Maradona’s tainted urine sample from the 1994 World Cup.

title: Our review of the Apple Watch Series 9
description: Double Tap, Precision Finding and WatchOS 10 make the Apple Watch Series 9 one of the best smartwatches available.

title: For these Black centenarians, life just keeps getting better
description: Many dread aging, but for some Black centenarians, 100 is just another number.

title: A new cure for sickle cell disease may be coming. FDA advisers will review it next week.
description: A sickle cell disease treatment that uses the gene-editing tool CRISPR will be reviewed by an FDA advisory panel next week, which could pave the way for approval.

title: Arizona's Maricopa County shatters record for heat deaths
description: Health officials in Arizona’s Maricopa County reported nearly 500 heat-related deaths this summer, making 2023 the region’s deadliest year on record when it comes to extreme temperatures.

title: Told to leave northern Gaza, this Palestinian family is staying put
description: Every day, Omyma Olwan and her family get a robocall from the Israeli military with a warning: “You might be a target and your life is in danger.”

title: Pilot who passed out reunites with passenger who landed plane with no flying experience
description: In a surprise reunion on NBC's "TODAY" show, a passenger with no flying experience who landed a nose-diving plane and the pilot whose life he helped save shared a heartfelt hug more than a year in the making.

title: 'A head scratcher': Dems baffled by Dean Phillips quixotic bid against Biden
description: House Democrats are baffled by Rep. Dean Phillip's decision to launch a primary challenge against President Joe Biden.

title: Sam Bankman-Fried admits FTX 'sure should have' done more to protect customers' money
description: Facing decades in prison on fraud and money laundering charges, FTX co-founder Sam Bankman-Fried testified in his own defense on Friday.

title: Man missing for 2 weeks at sea found alive, drifting in life raft off Washington coast
description: A man on a boat from Washington state that went missing over two weeks ago was found floating in a raft in the Pacific, the U.S.

title: From the Lavender Scare to the AIDS epidemic, 'Fellow Travelers' tells an epic gay love story
description: The Showtime limited series Fellow Travelers, starring Matt Bomer and Jonathan Bailey, chronicles the romance between gay men through LGBTQ history.

title: Border Patrol emails show Elon Musk visit caught officers off guard
description: Border Patrol officials received no official requests ahead of Elon Musk’s visit to the U.S.-Mexico border, according to emails obtained by NBC News.

title: Ohio woman charged with 'serial killings' allegedly met men for sex before fatally drugging them
description: An Ohio woman was charged in connection to the deaths of at least four men she had met for sex, authorities said, in what could be a burgeoning serial killer case.

title: Judge orders Ivanka Trump to testify in $250 million fraud case
description: The judge overseeing the $250 million civil trial against Donald Trump and his company ordered the former president's daughter Ivanka Trump to testify in the case.

title: A new hope for Ukraine aid in Washington
description: Congress may have a viable path to passing Ukraine aid separately from funding for Israel after Speaker Mike Johnson was sworn in.

title: Louisiana college cancels its football season after teammate is fatally shot
description: Northwestern State has canceled the remainder of its football season, citing the need to attend to the mental health of its players in the wake of the shooting death of safety Ronnie Caldwell.

title: Body of missing Milwaukee boy, 5, found in a dumpster; teen among 2 in custody
description: Two people, including a 15-year-old boy, have been arrested after the body of a 5-year-old boy was found Thursday in a Milwaukee trash dumpster.

title: No one expected a World Series with the Texas Rangers and Arizona Diamondbacks
description: The Arizona Diamondbacks barely won more games than they lost, while the Texas Rangers stumbled in the regular season's final days to surrender their long-held division lead.

title: Self-driving taxi startup Cruise freezes operations after California revokes permits
description: General Motors-owned tech startup Cruise said Thursday it was pausing all driverless operations across the U.S.

title: Rep. George Santos to be arraigned on new charges in federal fraud case
description: Rep. George Santos, R-N.Y., will be arraigned on additional charges, including allegations of identity theft and using donors' credit cards.

title: Former Arizona GOP Senate candidate Blake Masters is running for Congress
description: Republican Blake Masters, who lost to Democratic Sen. Mark Kelly in last year’s election, announced he is the latest candidate in a crowded Arizona congressional race.

title: A year after Elon Musk bought Twitter, LGBTQ people say it has become toxic
description: A year after billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk finalized his $44 billion purchase of Twitter, some LGBTQ people say the once-hospitable home for community building has turned toxic.

title: Teen acquaintance charged with murder in the killing of a Philadelphia journalist
description: An acquaintance has been charged in the death of a Philadelphia journalist who went from sleeping on the street to working for the mayor to writing columns on the city’s most pressing social issues.

title: Maine manhunt enters third day and U.S. strikes targets in Syria: Morning Rundown
description: A manhunt spans the Northeast as the Maine mass shooter remains at large.

title: Ottawa’s Shane Pinto suspended for 41 games in NHL's first modern sports betting ban
description: The NHL suspended Ottawa Senators forward Shane Pinto for 41 games on Thursday, making the 22-year-old American the first modern-day hockey player banned for sports gambling.

title: In a race defined by Trump, Mike Pence defines himself
description: Mike Pence’s campaign has also been about reintroducing himself to voters — and perhaps to history — on his own terms, not only as Donald Trump’s No. 2.

title: Multistate manhunt underway for mass shooting suspect
description: Multistate manhunt underway for mass shooting suspect

title: Homicide suspect who escaped from Washington, D.C., hospital is captured
description: More than six weeks after he escaped from a Washington, D.C., hospital, a man initially arrested in connection with a murder was recaptured Thursday, officials said.

title: Democratic Rep. Dean Phillips launches a White House bid, challenging Biden
description: The Democratic congressman has been a staunch critic of Biden’s re-election bid and has previously called on other candidates to challenge the president.

title: Mayor admits communication failure after police ran over a man and didn’t notify his family
description: The mayor of Jackson, Mississippi, said his police department meant no harm when it failed to tell Dexter Wade's mother that he had been killed and buried in a pauper’s field.

title: A mass shooting roils a Maine city where 'everybody kind of knows everybody'
description: Lewiston, Maine, has problems with drugs and homelessness, but it has always been relatively safe, spared the rampant gun violence of other American cities.

title: Li Keqiang, China’s top economic official for a decade, dies at 68
description: Former Premier Li Keqiang, China’s top economic official for a decade, died Friday of a heart attack.

title: U.S. launches strikes on Iranian-linked targets in Syria in retaliation for drone attacks on U.S. military bases
description: The U.S. launched strikes on targets in Syria on Thursday in retaliation for drone attacks on U.S. military bases in the region, said Defense Secretary Austin.

title: Maine Democrat calls his earlier opposition to an assault weapons ban a mistake after Lewiston shootings
description: Rep. Jared Golden was one of five House Democrats who voted against legislation last year that would have banned assault weapons.

title: What we know about Biden and Johnson's working relationship
description: Biden, who doesn't know Mike Johnson well, is first going to try to work with the new speaker to get additional aid for Ukraine and Israel and domestic priorities.

title: Nightly News Full Broadcast (October 26th)
description: Lester Holt anchors tonight from Lewiston, Maine, covering the urgent manhunt for the gunman who killed at least 18 people. Also, Israel launched a “targeted” ground raid in Gaza, and there’s news on the suspect wanted in the killing of a Maryland judge.
